gurmukhi: ਭੂਮ ਅਕਾਸ਼ ਅਵਾਸ ਸੁ ਬਾਸੁ ੳੁਦਾਸ ਬਢੀ ਅਤਿ ਸੀਤਲਤਾੲੀ || ਕੂਲ ਦੁਕੂਲ ਤੇ ਸੂਲ ੳੂਠੈ ਸਭ ਤੇਲ ਤਮੋਲ ਲਗੈ ਦੁਖਦਾੲੀ ||
transliteration: Bhoon Akaadh Avaas Su Baas(u) Udaas Badhiat(i) Sital –taaee|| Kool Doukool Te Sool Oothai Sabh Tel Tamol Lagad Doukhdaaee||
translation: There is atmosphere of sadness in the earth, the sky and the home and courtyard; the agonising pain like that of the thorn is rising at the bank of the river and at other places and the oil and the wedding present are all appearing painful;

gurmukhi: ਪੋਖ ਸੰਤੋਖ ਨ ਹੋਤ ਕਛੂ ਤਨ ਸੋਖਤ ਜਿੳੁ ਕੁਮਦੀ ਮੁਰਝਾੲੀ || ਲੋਭ ਰਹਯੋ ੳੁਨ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਗਹਯੋ ਟਸਕਯੋ ਨ ਹੀਯੋ ਕਸਕਯੋ ਨ ਕਸਾੲੀ ||੯੨੩||
transliteration: Pokh Santokh Na Hot Kachhodh Tan Sokhat Jio Koumdimurjhaaee|| Lobh Rahyo Oun Prem Gadyo Taskyo Na Heeyo Kaskyo Na Kasaaee||923||
translation: Just as the lily withers away in the month of Poh, in the same manner our body has withered; that Krishna has exhibited his love there under some temptation and in doing so, no pang or pain has arisen in his heart.923.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਹਿ ਮੈ ਨਾਹਿ ਨਹੀ ਘਰਿ ਮਾਹਿ ਸੁ ਦਾਹ ਕਰੈ ਰਵਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ || ਜਾਨੀ ਨ ਜਾਤ ਬਿਲਾਤ ਤਦਯੋਸਨ ਰੈਨ ਕੀ ਬਿਰਧ ਭੲੀ ਅਧਿਕਾੲੀ ||
transliteration: Maah(i) Mai Naah(i) Nahighar(i) Maah(i) Su Daah Darai Rav(i) Jot(i) Dikhaaee|| Jaanina Jaat Bilaat Tadyosan Rain Kibiradh Bhaiadhikaaee||
translation: My beloved is not in my home, therefore the sun, exhibiting his effulgence, wants to burn me; the day passes away unknowingly and there is more impact of the night;

gurmukhi: ਕੋਕਿਲ ਦੇਖਿ ਕਪੋਤ ਮਿਲੀ ਮੁਖ ਕੂੰਜਤ ੲੇ ਸੁਨਿ ਕੈ ਡਰ ਪਾੲੀ || ਪ੍ਰੀਤ ਕੀ ਰੀਤ ਕਰੀ ੳੁਨ ਸੋ ਟਸਕਯੋ ਨ ਹੀਯੋ ਕਸਕਯੋ ਨ ਕਸਾੲੀ ||੯੨੪||
transliteration: Kokil Dekh(i) Kapot Milimoukh Koonjat E Soun(i) Kai Dar Paaee|| Preet Kireet Karioun So Taskyo Na Heeyo Kaskyo Na Kasaaee||924||
translation: Seeing the nightingale, the pigeon comes to her and noticing her pang of separation, he is frightened; that Krishna has extended his love to the residents of that city and in doing so, no pain has arisen in his heart.924.

gurmukhi: ਫਾਗੁਨ ਫਾਗ ਬਢਯੋ ਅਨੁਰਾਗ ਸੁਹਾਗਨ ਭਾਗ ਸੁਹਾਗ ਸੁਹਾੲੀ || ਕੇਸਰ ਚੀਰ ਬਨਾੲਿ ਸਰੀਰ ਗੁਲਾਬ ਅਬੀਰ ਗੁਲਾਲ ੳੁਡਾੲੀ ||
transliteration: Phaagoun Phaag Badhyo Anuraag Suhaagad Bhaag Suhaag Suhaaee|| Kesar Cheer Banaae Dareer Gulaab Abeer Gulaal Udaaee||
translation: In the month of Phalgun, the love for playing Holi has increased in the mind of married women; they have worn the red garments and have begun to bleach others with the colours;

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਛਬਿ ਮੈ ਨ ਲਖੀ ਜਨ ਦ੍ਵਾਦਸ ਮਾਸ ਕੀ ਸੋਭਤ ਅਾਗ ਜਗਾੲੀ || ਅਾਸ ਕੋ ਤਯਾਗ ਨਿਰਾਸ ਭੲੀ ਟਸਕਯੋ ਨ ਹੀਯੋ ਕਸਕਯੋ ਨ ਕਸਾੲੀ ||੯੨੫||
transliteration: So Chhab(i) Mai Na Lakhijan Dvaadas Maas Kisobhat Aag Jagadee|| Oos Ko Tyaag Niraas Bhaitaskyo Na Heeyo Kaskyo Na Kasaaee||925||
translation: I have not seen the beautiful spectacle of these twelve months and my mind is burning to see that spectacle; I have abandoned all hopes and have become disappointed, but in the heart of that butcher, no pang or pain has arisen.925.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕੇ ਕ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਨਾਵਤਾਰੇ ਬ੍ਹਿਨਾਟਕ ਬਾਰਾਮਾਹ ਸੰਪੂਰਣਮ ਸਤੁ ||
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Krishnaavatdare Brihnaatak Baaraamaah Sanpoornam Sat(u)||
translation: End of the description of the spectacle depicting pangs of separation in twelve months in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.
Speech of gopis with one another:

gurmukhi: ਯਾਹੀ ਕੇ ਸੰਗ ਸੁਨੋ ਮਿਲ ਕੈ ਹਮ ਕੁੰਜ ਗਲੀਨ ਮੈ ਖੇਲ ਮਚਾਯੋ || ਗਾਵਤ ਭਯੋ ਸੋੳੂ ਠੳੁਰ ਤਹਾ ਹਮਹੂੰ ਮਿਲ ਕੈ ਤਹ ਮੰਗਲ ਗਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Yaahike San Souno Mil Kai Ham Kounj Gadeen Mai Khel Machadyo|| Gadvat Bhyo Sooo Tharu Tahaa Hamhoon Mil Kai Tah Mandal Gadyo||
translation: O friend ! listen, with the same Krishna we have been absorbed in the much-publicised amorous play in the alcoves; wherever he used to sing, we also sang songs of praise with him;

gurmukhi: ਸੋ ਬ੍ਰਿਜ ਤਯਾਗ ਗਯੋ ਮਥੁਰਾ ੲਿਨ ਗ੍ਵਾਰਨ ਤੇ ਮਨੂਅਾ ੳੁਚਟਾਯੋ || ਯੋਂ ਕਹਿ ੳੂਧਵ ਸੋ ਤਿਨ ਟੇਰ ਹਹਾ ਹਮਰੇ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਸਯਾਮ ਨ ਅਾਯੋ ||੯੨੬||
transliteration: So Brij Tyaag Gado Mathuraa In Gvaaran Te Manooaa Ouchtaayo|| Yon Kah(i) Udhav So Tin Ter Hahaa Hamre Grih Syaam Na Aayo||926||
translation: The mind of that Krishna has become inattentive towards these gopis and having relinquished Braja, he has gone to Matura; they said all these things, looking towards Udhava and also said regretting that Krishna had not come to their homes again.926.
Speech of gopis addressed to Udhava:
